snippet.textDisplay: 0:50 It's not power over artist really. It was just a case of MASS constructive criticism that was 100% correct and fair. There is a difference between an artist expressing themselves on like their own personal project....versus working as an artist for a professional business and making a product that has an ultimate GOAL of being POPULAR with people.
snippet.textOriginal: 0:50 It's not power over artist really.  It was just a case of MASS constructive criticism that was 100% correct and fair. snippet.textDisplay:
I wasnt originally going too see this movie even after they changed the design, but after watching a few reviews expecting it too be a dumpster fire I was shocked too here that it was genuinely good. I was curious after watching these reviews so I decided too watch it. I was still not expecting much but I actually kinda liked it walking out of the theater. Nothing amazing but the amazing thing is that it was one of the few good video game movies too come out that was passable.

Mind you this isnt really coming from a sonic fan, I just simply respect the series.
snippet.textOriginal:
I wasnt originally going too see this movie even after they changed the design, but after watching a few reviews expecting it too be a dumpster fire I was shocked too here that it was genuinely good. I was curious after watching these reviews so I decided too watch it. I was still not expecting much but I actually kinda liked it walking out of the theater. Nothing amazing but the amazing thing is that it was one of the few good video game movies too come out that was passable.

snippet.textDisplay:
My two top Game to Film adaptations are:
Sonic the Hedgehog
Silent Hill! (The first one, not 2nd no no)


So wow Chris, I'm surprised you liked this and went pretty easy on it! So far one I've watched was too nit-picky. But yasss I adore this movie, some kids were sitting next to me with their daddy, and they all laughed and everyone laughed in the theater and it pleased me so much, and I too laughed my ass off. There were those really epic moments that I loved too, I cannot wait to get this movie and potentially use it for some videos on my channel!

snippet.textDisplay:
This was a surprisingly well done film!

Very cliche, many logic gaps, and two bad hard edit points, but so, so much fun to watch! James Marsden does a great job as the everyman, Jim Carrey just evil enough to be a bad guy, not scary enough to be too much for a kids film.

I think there are SEVERAL sequels in the future!
snippet.textOriginal:
This was a surprisingly well done film!  

Very cliche, many logic gaps, and two bad hard edit points, but so, so much fun to watch!  James Marsden does a great job as the everyman, Jim Carrey just evil enough to be a bad guy, not scary enough to be too much for a kids film.

I think there are SEVERAL sequels in the future!

snippet.textDisplay: To everyone saying “It’s just a kids movie” I just have to ask, is Star Wars a kids movie? Should we not criticize Episode 9? Oh, no you’re saying while Episode 9 is meant for children it’s also made for adults, especially those who grew up with the franchise..... that’s sounds a lot like Sonic now doesn’t it? Is Sonic not a kids movie? You see this is all so dumb, where do we draw the line? you can make a good kids movie, you can make a bad kids movie, and if you have to say “it’s just a kids movie” to defend a movie then you’re really only trying to justify why it’s bad rather say why it’s good. It’s a product, you can criticize it.
snippet.textOriginal: To everyone saying “It’s just a kids movie” I just have to ask, is Star Wars a kids movie? Should we not criticize Episode 9? Oh, no you’re saying while Episode 9 is meant for children it’s also made for adults, especially those who grew up with the franchise..... that’s sounds a lot like Sonic now doesn’t it? Is Sonic not a kids movie? You see this is all so dumb, where do we draw the line? you can make a good kids movie, you can make a bad kids movie, and if you have to say “it’s just a kids movie” to defend a movie then you’re really only trying to justify why it’s bad rather say why it’s good. It’s a product, you can criticize it.

snippet.textDisplay: The worst thing about getting older is how we over-analyze everything, we find logic and meaning in things and in the process destroy the wonder we used to see as kids. This movie made me feel like a kid again and that's not always a bad thing. It is not a great movie, but it served its purpose as a movie in that it was made to entertain me, and it did.
snippet.textOriginal: The worst thing about getting older is how we over-analyze everything, we find logic and meaning in things and in the process destroy the wonder we used to see as kids. This movie made me feel like a kid again and that's not always a bad thing. It is not a great movie, but it served its purpose as a movie in that it was made to entertain me, and it did.

"Does character design make a movie? Absolutely not."

snippet.textDisplay: I’d like to say that every yawn in the movie became worth it after seeing Jim Carrey’s final scene!  Holy that was hilarious, surreal, video game, Bradbury, Carreyesque!  It was a scene that looks back on the movie and says “it is done!” and looks forward and says “let’s make it happen!”  Whatever Jim does in the future I hope they are based in pop culture nostalgia but also productions that do give a damn.
snippet.textOriginal: I’d like to say that every yawn in the movie became worth it after seeing Jim Carrey’s final scene!  Holy that was hilarious, surreal, video game, Bradbury, Carreyesque!  It was a scene that looks back on the movie and says “it is done!” and looks forward and says “let’s make it happen!”  Whatever Jim does in the future I hope they are based in pop culture nostalgia but also productions that do give a damn.

snippet.textDisplay: Thanks Chris. You should never write down to chidren. If they don't get it, they will later, when they watch it as an adult. I remember Corpse Bride. One reviewer said there was there different acts of perversion in the movie. I only got the two wives, and beeing envolved with a dead woman. Regardless, nothing was tamed down. Another reviewer said, "So what, if it scaries a child. I loved being frighten as childen." Most of my friends hate Tim Burtan, but I've never seen a product placement is his personal movies. Whether you liked Corpse Bride, or not, all children movies should be made that way. Hell, the Jack Skellitoning merch is still selling like mad.
